timeline.message: Make classids able to handle concurrent reads/writes
Unsync unregister and sync on metadata the critical part

timeline.bodyText: Why compute the labels id before it is needed? This is a costly operation.
timeline.author: hbs

timeline.bodyText: On line 632 (in register), the call to metadatas.get() could throw an NPE if the entry for that class name is removed on line 598. The solution would be to protect the part in register with a syncrhonized block on metadatas
timeline.author: hbs

replies.bodyText: So register and unregister might have to be mutually exclusive, hence maybe both synchronized
replies.author: hbs

replies.bodyText: I tried to reduce at the minimum synchronization, avoiding making method synchronized.
replies.author: ftence

timeline.message: Tighter synchronisation to avoid NPE due to concurrent modifications

timeline.bodyText: Actually second thoughts about where labelsId is computed. If it is occasional to call unregister for a GTS whose class is  no longer known it might be better to always compute labelsId where labelsId is declared rather than in the synchronized block since the computation is CPU heavy and therefore would extend the time spent in the syncrhonized block which would block all threads attempting to synchronize on metadatas. So probably better to always compute labelsId and do so outside of the synchronized block.
timeline.author: hbs
